title: Shpongle
text:
{{short description|English psychedelic electronic music project}} {{Use British English|date=October 2011}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Shpongle | image=Shpongle_in_Moscow.jpg | caption = Shpongle performing in 2015 | image_size = 300px | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Chobham]], [[Surrey]], England | genre = [[Psybient]], [[psytrance]], [[psydub]] | years_active = 1996–present | label = [[Twisted Records (UK)|Twisted UK]]
[[Kinetic Records|Kinetic]]/[[Bertelsmann Music Group|BMG Records]] (US) | associated_acts = 1200 Micrograms, [[Hallucinogen (musician)|Hallucinogen]], [[The Infinity Project]], [[Younger Brother]], [[Celtic Cross (band)|Celtic Cross]], [[Ott (record producer)|Ott]] | website = [http://www.shponglemusic.com/ www.shponglemusic.com] | current_members = [[Hallucinogen (musician)|Simon Posford]]
[[Raja Ram (musician)|Raja Ram]]
Michele Adamson | past_members = }} '''Shpongle''' is a [[psychedelic music|psychedelic electronic music]] project from England that formed in 1996. The group includes [[Hallucinogen (musician)|Hallucinogen]] and [[Raja Ram (musician)|Raja Ram]] (one of three in [[The Infinity Project]]). The duo are considered to be one of the [[progenitor]]s of the [[psybient]] genre - a genre combining [[world music]] with [[psychedelic trance]] and [[ambient music|ambient]]. Their musical style combines [[traditional music]] from all over the world and vocals with contemporary western [[synthesizer]]-based psychedelic music. When asked to describe Shpongle's music, Posford has responded that it is "like nothing you've ever heard before."{{cite web|url=https://www.myspace.com/therealshpongle |title=SHPONGLE | Listen and Stream Free Music, Albums, New Releases, Photos, Videos |publisher=Myspace.com |access-date=2014-07-25}} Shpongle's first track, "Vapour Rumours", was released on TIP Records' ''Infinite Excursions'' compilation in 1996.{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/release/48877 |title=Various - Infinite Excursions - Softer Psychedelic Sounds (CD) at Discogs |publisher=Discogs.com |access-date=2014-07-25}} Their debut album, ''[[Are You Shpongled?]]'', was released in 1998 on [[Twisted Records (UK)|Twisted Records]]. On 9 September 2014, Posford confirmed beginning work on a sixth album, which was released as ''Codex VI'' on October 23rd 2017. On 3 October, even before the release of ''Codex VI'', the duo announced via a Facebook video that they have begun working on their seventh studio album. Since June 30th, the duo have also been releasing remasters of their previous albums, focussing on releasing special edition vinyl records.{{Cite web|url=https://shponglemusic.bandcamp.com/album/are-you-shpongled-remastered|title=Are You Shpongled? (Remastered), by Shpongle}} Posford is generally responsible for the synthesizers, studio work, and live instrumentation, while Raja Ram contributes broad musical concepts and flute arrangements. Raja Ram stated in an interview that "Shpongle" is an [[umbrella term]] for feeling positive and euphoric emotions.{{cite web|url=http://www.nme.com/artists/shpongle |title=Shpongle Biography |website=NME|access-date=17 December 2009 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091229123531/http://www.nme.com/artists/shpongle |archive-date=29 December 2009 }} Shpongle's music is heavily influenced by [[psychedelic experience]]s and frequently makes use of sonic textures that approximate [[psychedelic state]]s as well as vocal samples relating to [[consciousness expansion]], [[hallucinations]], and [[altered states of awareness]]. For example, the track "A New Way to Say 'Hooray'", contains a vocal sample of [[Terence McKenna]] describing the effects of [[Dimethyltryptamine|DMT]]. ==Shpongle live== Shpongle has played several live concerts, and Simon Posford tours frequently, performing live DJ sets. Raja Ram has occasionally accompanied these sets with live flute performances.{{cite web | url=http://www.shpongle.org/index.php?menu=gallery&subpage=israel | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080430002829/http://www.shpongle.org/index.php?menu=gallery&subpage=israel | archive-date=30 April 2008 | title=Gallery - Israel | date=2002 | publisher=Shpongle | access-date=19 October 2019 }}{{cite web | author = kellersci1 | date = 20 July 2009 | url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EXsqfpxoa00 | title = Shpongle - DMT at Camp Bisco 2009 | publisher = youtube.com | access-date = 17 September 2009 }} Shpongle's first live performance was at the Solstice Music Festival at Motosu Highland in Japan in July 2001.{{cite web | author = Zorro York | date = 16 August 2001 | url = http://www.residentadvisor.net/review-view.aspx?id=56 | title = Solstice Music Festival 2001 | publisher = residentadvisor.net | access-date = 10 November 2008 }} They returned to Japan on New Year's Eve 2003 to play the New Maps of Hyperspace event at [[Tokyo Bay NK Hall]] together with 1200 Micrograms (featuring Raja Ram) and Hallucinogen.Archived at [https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211211/DDwx5wlcoxo Ghostarchive]{{cbignore}} and the [https://web.archive.org/web/20110204114130/http://www.youtube.com:80/watch?v=DDwx5wlcoxo Wayback Machine]{{cbignore}}: {{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DDwx5wlcoxo |title=Shpongle - Around the World in a Tea Daze Tokyo Live - YouTube |publisher=Uk.youtube.com |date=2008-02-23 |access-date=2014-07-25}}{{cbignore}} Prior to the release of their fourth album Shpongle played a sold out live concert at [[The Roundhouse]] venue in [[Chalk Farm]], North London on 31 October 2008. The band featured [[Andy Gangadeen]] (drums), Nogera (percussion), Chris Taylor (bass), Pete Callard (guitar), [[Harry Escott]] (cello) and Dick Trevor (keyboards and programming); Michele Adamson and Hari Om (voices), three dancers, and for one song only ("Nothing is Something Worth Doing") [[Manu Delago]] on [[Hang (musical instrument)|hand pan]].{{cite web | date = 2 November 2008 | url = http://www.twistedmusic.com/forums/viewthread/2122/ | title = The Shpongle Live Show in October | publisher = twisted.co.uk | access-date = 10 November 2008 | url-status = dead | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20090512021833/http://www.twistedmusic.com/forums/viewthread/2122/ | archive-date = 12 May 2009}} This was followed on 20 December 2008 by a concert in Moscow featuring the same lineup. Shows were also planned for 7 and 9 March 2009 in Sydney and Melbourne, Australia, but these were cancelled due to non-payment of the deposit by the promoters.{{cite web | author = Simon Holton | date = 10 December 2008 | url = http://twisted.co.uk/shponglelive/Shpongle_Live_in_Australia_Statement08.12.08.html | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20110720134353/http://twisted.co.uk/shponglelive/Shpongle_Live_in_Australia_Statement08.12.08.html | archive-date = 2011-07-20 | title = Twisted statement | publisher = twisted.co.uk | access-date = 31 December 2008 }} [[File:Dorset Perception - Shpongle live at Psy-Fi 2017.webm|thumb|Shpongle performing live at [[Psy-Fi]] 2017 in the Netherlands.]] In 2009, Shpongle played a headlining date at the [[Ozora Festival]] held near [[Ozora]], [[Hungary]] on 15 August;{{cite web | author = Twisted Music | date = 16 January 2009 | url = http://www.twistedmusic.com/news/news_shpongle_live_at_ozora_festival_15th_august_2009/ | title = Shpongle Live confirmed for OZORA Festival 15th August 2009 | publisher = Twisted Music | access-date = 14 February 2009 | url-status = dead | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20090216195749/http://twistedmusic.com/news/news_shpongle_live_at_ozora_festival_15th_august_2009 | archive-date = 16 February 2009}} Shpongle also played a latenight DJ set at Rothbury Festival in Rothbury, Michigan over Fourth of July weekend and two album launch shows at the Roundhouse on 30 and 31 October.{{cite web | author = Twisted Music | date = 13 February 2009 | url = http://www.twistedmusic.com/news/news_shpongle_live_at_the_roundhouse_london_30th_october_2009/ | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20090219205819/http://www.twistedmusic.com/news/news_shpongle_live_at_the_roundhouse_london_30th_october_2009/ | url-status = dead | archive-date = 19 February 2009 | title = Shpongle live return to The Roundhouse, London, 30 October 2009 for the new album launch! | publisher = Twisted Music | access-date = 14 February 2009 }} The duo returned to Moscow to play at Milk on 12 December 2009. On 3 August 2010, they opened the Ozora festival in Hungary. This was their tenth documented live performance. In January 2011, Shpongle toured Australia playing dates at the Forum Theatre in Melbourne, the Enmore Theatre in Sydney and headlined the [[Rainbow Serpent Festival]] in Victoria, Australia.{{cite web | url = http://www.shpongleaustralia.com/ | title = Shpongle Australia | publisher = Shpongleaustralia.com | access-date = 27 November 2010 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20101030125334/http://www.shpongleaustralia.com/ | archive-date = 30 October 2010 | url-status = dead }} In June 2011 Shpongle played at the Electric Forest Festival with the Shpongletron.Archived at [https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211211/ORBFxzfhKQg Ghostarchive]{{cbignore}} and the [https://web.archive.org/web/20140630062923/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ORBFxzfhKQg Wayback Machine]{{cbignore}}: {{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ORBFxzfhKQg |title=Shpongle @ Electric Forest 2011 DMT Shpongletron Divine Moments of Truth - Dorset Perception |publisher=[[YouTube]] |access-date=2014-07-25}}{{cbignore}} New unreleased material from the forthcoming album was incorporated in the 2011 tour, the Shpongletron Experience. The tour featured the [[Zebbler#Shpongletron|Shpongletron]], designed by visual artist [[Zebbler]]. The Shpongletron included a DJ booth, and multiple custom-made, [[video mapping|video-mapped]] projection surfaces. "Shpongle Live" performed at Camp Bisco X on 8 July 2011 in Mariaville, New York. This was Shpongle's first ever performance as a full ensemble in the United States and was greatly received by fans and newcomers alike. The band also performed two sold-out American shows on Halloween weekend in 2011, playing at the [[Hammerstein Ballroom]] in [[New York City]] on 28 October, and at the [[Fox Oakland Theater]] in [[Oakland, California]] on 29 October. They debuted the first track from ''Museum of Consciousness'', called "Brain in a Fish Tank," on 28 October 2011.{{Cite web|url=http://new.sensiblereason.com/shpongle-live-at-the-hammerstein-ballroom-review/|title=Shpongle Live at the Hammerstein Ballroom: Review|first=Jeff|last=Kurtz|date=8 November 2011|website=Sensiblereason.com|access-date=2020-06-27}} For 2012, Shpongle toured the United States performing DJ sets entitled "Shpongle presents The Masquerade". The last set of this tour was performed on 31 October 2012, at Terminal West in Atlanta, Georgia. On 3 November, they performed with Younger Brother, Hallucinogen, and other Twisted Records artists.{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/events/147795015359007/ |title=Twisted Music presents Twistival - Shpongle, Younger Brother, Hallucinogen, Prometheus, OTT, The Zap, In:terlaken |publisher=Facebook |access-date=2014-07-25}} Their set included live keyboards and flute, and debuted many new tracks from their most recent album. After the ceremony in 2010, on 6 August 2013 Shpongle is once again opening O.Z.O.R.A. Festival with a world premier concert for their new material called ''[[Museum of Consciousness]]'' (2013). Oct. 2013 full band live in London at the [[Troxy]]. The show was filmed and is available on DVD, released in 2015.{{cite web|url=http://shponglemusic.com/liveinlondon/gbp.php |title=Shpongle Live in London |publisher=Shpongle|access-date=2016-08-14}} Shpongle played live with a full 12 piece band at Red Rocks Amphitheater in [[Morrison, Colorado]], on 10 May 2014. The concert was filmed, and released on 23 October 2015 as [[Shpongle - Live at Red Rocks]].{{cite web|url=https://www.discogs.com/Shpongle-Live-At-Red-Rocks/release/7659501|title=Shpongle – Live at Red Rocks|publisher=Discogs|access-date=2019-09-29}} On 19 November 2014, it was announced via social media that Shpongle would once again begin touring in the United States throughout early 2015, featuring Phutureprimitive as special guest, the return of "Shpongletron 3.1," and with visuals by [[Zebbler]]. On 21 September 2018, Shpongle announced their last full public concerts,{{cite web|url=http://www.shponglemusic.com/news/shpongle-live-in-concert-at-red-rocks/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181028111504/http://www.shponglemusic.com/news/shpongle-live-in-concert-at-red-rocks/|url-status=dead|archive-date=2018-10-28|title=SHPONGLE LIVE IN CONCERT AT RED ROCKS|publisher=Shpongle|access-date=2019-09-29}} two consecutive nights at [[Red Rocks Amphitheatre]] on 3/4 May 2019:
Although this is their last full public concert, Shpongle will continue to enchant and delight with future studio recordings and album releases, with some Shpongle 7 productions receiving their world premieres at this performance.
==Discography== === Studio albums === * ''[[Are You Shpongled?]]'' (1998) * ''[[Tales of the Inexpressible]]'' (2001) * ''[[Nothing Lasts... But Nothing Is Lost]]'' (2005) * ''[[Ineffable Mysteries from Shpongleland]]'' (2009) * ''[[Museum of Consciousness]]'' (2013) * ''[[Codex VI]]'' (2017) ===EP albums=== * ''[[Divine Moments of Truth]]'' (2000) * ''[[Dorset Perception]]'' (2004) * ''[[The God Particle (EP)|The God Particle]]'' (2010) * ''[[Carnival of Peculiarities]]'' (2021) ===Remix albums=== * ''Remixed'' (2003) * ''Remixed volume 2'' (2005) * ''Unreleased Remixes'' (2008) (download only) * Shpongle & Mad Tribe – ''Stoned Remixes'' (2016-05-09, [[Tip Records]], ''download'')[http://www.tiprecords.com/promo/Stoned_Remixes/ Shpongle & Mad Tribe - Stoned Remixes]. Tip Records [retrieved 2016-06-12] ===Other songs=== * "The Sixth Revelation" on ''The Mystery of the Thirteen Crystal Skulls'' (2001) * "The Seventh Revelation" on ''The Secret of the Thirteen Crystal Skulls'' (2003) ===DVD releases=== * ''Live in Concert at the Roundhouse London 2008'' (2009) * ''Live in London 2014'' (2015) * ''Live at Red Rocks Amphitheater'' (2015) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://shponglemusic.com/ Official Shpongle website] * [http://www.discogs.com/artist/Shpongle Shpongle at discogs.com] * [https://www.myspace.com/therealshpongle Simon Posford's myspace.com profile] * [http://www.twistedmusic.com/ Twisted Records] * [https://www.reddit.com/r/shpongle/ Shpongle at reddit] {{Authority control}} [[Category:Musical groups established in 1996]] [[Category:British electronic music groups]] [[Category:Psychedelic trance musical groups]] [[Category:British musical trios]] Category:Musical groups from Surrey]]
